night.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the dark part of each 24-hour period when the sun cannot be seen and when most people sleep
night.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: It was a cold moonlit night.
I didn’t sleep too well last night.
At night the temperature drops below zero.
He woke up twice during the night.
There was a storm on Friday night.
night.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the time during the evening until you go to bed
night.translation[0].definitions[1].note: quiz night/student night etc (=an evening when a particular event happens, especially at a bar, club etc)
night.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: We had a really good meal last night.
They stay in and watch television every night.
She recognised him from the night before  (=the previous evening).
My parents are coming for dinner tomorrow night.
We were on our way back from a night out  (=an evening when you go to a party, restaurant, theatre etc) at the theatre.
Anna doesn’t like him walking home late at night.
There’s a party at Ben’s place on Saturday night.

I’m really tired - I need an early night.

We spent two nights at the Grand Hotel.
You’re welcome to stay the night if you like.

It grew colder as night fell.
The pain gradually got better as the night wore on.

The night air was scented with jasmine.
I took the night train to Fort William.
He looked as if he’d been up all night.
The noise continued all night long!

in the middle of the night

night.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with night
night.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0: You say that something happens on a particular night
The children stayed at their grandmother’s on Friday night
There will be a full moon on the night of October 21
They asked him where he was on the night of the fire
night.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1: You use in the night when saying that something happens at some time during a particular night
The baby kept crying in the night
The baby kept crying on the night
night.translation[0].note_box[1].items[2: You use at night when saying that something often happens during the night
The noise of the traffic keeps me awake at night
night.translation[0].note_box[1].items[3: You use by night when saying that a person or animal does something at night instead of during the day
They travelled by night to avoid being seen by the police
night.translation[0].note_box[2].heading: USAGE: At night or in the morning?
night.translation[0].note_box[2].items[0: You use at night when talking about a time before midnight
We didn’t get back till 11 o’clock at night
night.translation[0].note_box[2].items[1: You use in the morning when talking about a time after midnight
We had to get up at four in the morning
night.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: used to say goodbye to someone when it is late in the evening or when they are going to bed
